pyliquid.msms

This module defines the interface to MS/MS data

Module Reference

class pyliquid.msms.MSMSReaderDDA(mza_file)

object for accessing DDA MSMS data from MZA (HDF5) formatted files

The MZA files created from thermo orbitrap data have some peculiarities so a small, purpose-built reader is better than shoehorning the main MZA object for this purpose

Attributes
mza_filestr

path to MZA file

mzah5py.File

h5py File object for extracting information from the HDF5 file

idxnumpy.ndarray(int)

indices of all scans

rtnumpy.ndarray(float)

retention time

min_rtfloat
max_rtfloat

min/max retention time

min_mzfloat
max_mzfloat

min/max m/z

Methods

get_dda_pre_mzs([mz_bounds, rt_bounds, ...])

Reads the metadata for all MS2 scans and returns a list of all unique precursor m/z values that were selected for DDA scans, sorted by m/z, rounded to <mz_precision> decimal places

get_ms1(rt_min, rt_max[, mz_bounds, mz_bin_size])

RT selected MS1 spectrum

get_ms2_dda(rt_min, rt_max, frag_type, pre_mz)

Selects and combines DDA MS2 spectra from a specified RT range, fragmentation type, and precursor m/z

get_tic()

TIC chromatogram

get_xic(mz_min, mz_max)

m/z selected XIC (MS1 scans only)

metadata(header)

retrieve the array of metadata from the specified header
pyliquid.msms.MSMSReaderDDA.__init__(self, mza_file)

init a new MSMSReader instance using the path to the source MZA (HDF5) file

Parameters
mza_filestr

file name (and optionally path to) the source MZA (HDF5) file

pyliquid.msms.MSMSReaderDDA.metadata(self, header)

retrieve the array of metadata from the specified header

Parameters
headerstr

specify which metadata header to fetch

Returns
metadata_columnnumpy.ndarray(?)

array of metadata (could be type float, int, or bytes depending on the header)

pyliquid.msms.MSMSReaderDDA.get_tic(self)

TIC chromatogram

Returns
tic_rtnumpy.ndarray(float)
tic_intnumpy.ndarray(float)

retention time/intensity components of TIC chromatogram as arrays

pyliquid.msms.MSMSReaderDDA.get_xic(self, mz_min, mz_max)

m/z selected XIC (MS1 scans only)

Parameters
mz_minfloat
mz_maxfloat

m/z selection bounds

Returns
xic_rtnumpy.ndarray(float)
xic_intnumpy.ndarray(float)

retention time/intensity components of XIC as arrays

pyliquid.msms.MSMSReaderDDA.get_ms1(self, rt_min, rt_max, mz_bounds=None, mz_bin_size=0.01)

RT selected MS1 spectrum

Parameters
rt_minfloat
rt_maxfloat

RT selection bounds

mz_boundstuple(float, float), optional

optionally restrict range of m/z values to include in spectrum

mz_bin_sizefloat, default=0.01

m/z binning interval for combining spectra

Returns
ms1_mznumpy.ndarray(float)
ms1_intnumpy.ndarray(float)

mz/intensity components of MS1 spectrum as arrays

pyliquid.msms.MSMSReaderDDA.get_ms2_dda(self, rt_min, rt_max, frag_type, pre_mz, pre_mz_tol=0.1, mz_bounds=None, mz_bin_size=0.01)

Selects and combines DDA MS2 spectra from a specified RT range, fragmentation type, and precursor m/z

Parameters
rt_minfloat
rt_maxfloat

RT selection bounds

frag_typestr

fragmentation type (‘CID’ or ‘HCD’)

pre_mzfloat

precursor m/z selection for DDA MS2 scan

pre_mz_tolfloat, default=0.05

precursor m/z tolerance

mz_boundstuple(float, float), optional

optionally restrict range of m/z values to include in spectrum

mz_bin_sizefloat, default=0.01

m/z binning interval for combining spectra

Returns
ms1_mznumpy.ndarray(float)
ms1_intnumpy.ndarray(float)

mz/intensity components of MS1 spectrum as arrays

pyliquid.msms.MSMSReaderDDA.get_dda_pre_mzs(self, mz_bounds=None, rt_bounds=None, mz_precision=2)

Reads the metadata for all MS2 scans and returns a list of all unique precursor m/z values that were selected for DDA scans, sorted by m/z, rounded to <mz_precision> decimal places

m/z and RT ranges can optionally be supplied to narrow down the list

Parameters
mz_boundstuple(float, float), optional

optionally restrict range of m/z values to include in list

rt_boundstuple(float, float), optional

optionally restrict range of RT values to include in list (based on precursor scan RT)

mz_precisionint, default=2

number of places to round m/z values to

Returns
pre_mzslist(float)

all unique precursor m/z values that were selected for DDA scanse, sorted by m/z, rounded to <mz_precision> decimal places
